metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15503 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
LibRaw before 0.20-RC1 lacks a thumbnail size range check. This affects decoders/unpack_thumb.cpp, postprocessing/mem_image.cpp, and utils/thumb_utils.cpp. For example, malloc(sizeof(libraw_processed_image_t)+T.tlength) occurs without validating T.tlength.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2
libraw20 - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: darktable package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.

kodi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.20.2-2ubuntu2').
rawtherapee package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
